description:
I like it because it is simple and does it's job well.
The only thing I would like to do is to be able to copy from the text editor 
to some other apps which is apparently not possible at the moment but
I hope the creators of the app will fix that at some point.
alright fuckit its good its got its own terminal multiplexer and not to mention its own plugin system look at the github page and Add plugins for micro PLEASE
summary: wouldnt recommend to SUPER ADVANCED USERS JK I RECCOMEND

description:
Nice little editor.
Works great on embedded systems.
thanks a lot. this editor is very like vim editor but i think micro is bether in future
Way better than nano and other editors, perfect for people coming from Windows.
Simple but effective. I use this pretty much everywhere now and just love it
Exactly what i was looking for! Keep going to add more features and plugins like autocompletion, emmet and...
At least I can know the keybinds
Claims it's installed on my system, but didn't bother to add itself to the programs list. No idea how to actually make this program run. Too bad there's no option for 0 stars.
I like it - easy to use with key-bindings resembling other editors copy, paste, save, duplicate line, undo, redo, etc.
it is minimal, has a lot of features, plugin support and a gentle learning curve!

It is funny how the Micro help text starts with the editor already running.
I couldn't figure how to start the program from the console because Discover failed to install anything in /usr/bin/. Then I remembered that Discover came from the KDE project and there it was in the KDE menu. How am I supposed to start it in case the GUI failes? Well, I just continue to use mcedit from Midnight Commander then.
summary: Micro Text Editor didn't start properly

description: Hace rato lo vengo usando y estoy maravillado. Rápido, cómodo e intuitivo.
